text: authors | body | category | created_at | headline | id | location | organizations | published_date | references | related_ids | severity | summary | tags | updated_at id: news_006 | headline: Microsoft to start using Anthropic models inside Office workflows (report) | summary: Reports indicate Microsoft will diversify by integrating Anthropic models into some Office 365 workflows while continuing to use OpenAI models. | body: On September 9, 2025 reporters covering Microsoftâ€™s AI strategy noted that the company plans to incorporate Anthropic models (Opus/Sonnet variants) into select Office workflows. The move is portrayed as strategic diversification: Microsoft will continue partnerships with OpenAI while using Anthropic technology for tasks where it is judged to perform better, such as slide generation and spreadsheet automation. The decision reflects platform vendors' trend to hedge across multiple foundation-model suppliers. | published_date: 2025-09-09T00:00:00Z | authors: ['news reports'] | organizations: ['Microsoft', 'Anthropic'] | tags: ['partnership', 'microsoft', 'anthropic', 'office'] | category: business | severity: medium | location: None | related_ids: ['news_002', 'news_003'] | references: [{'name': 'Reporter coverage', 'url': ''}] | created_at: 2025-09-10T06:30:00Z | updated_at: 2025-09-10T06:30:00Z
